articles.author: Renju Jose, Kirsty Needham, Byron Kaye
articles.description: Millions of Australians were left without a phone or internet connection on Wednesday after the country's second-largest telecommunications provider experienced an unexplained nationwide outage.
articles.title: Optus network outage affects millions of Australians

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Flexible workspace provider WeWork (WE.N) sought U.S. bankruptcy protection on Monday, crippled by a large debt pile and soaring losses due to lower demand for office space from cost-conscious customers.
articles.title: Explainer: Why WeWork failed, and what is next

articles.author: Heekyong Yang, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Operations at Kia Corp's (000270.KS) assembly plant in South Korea have been suspended due to disruptions in parts supplies, the carmaker said on Wednesday.
articles.title: South Korea's Kia halts assembly plant after fatal supplier accident

articles.author: Kevin Buckland
articles.description: Treasury yields and the dollar hovered above multi-week lows on Wednesday as markets grappled with the possibility of another U.S. interest rate hike while waiting on comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell for a steer on the policy outlook.
articles.title: US yields languish above lows before Powell remarks; oil sags

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: Amazon.com's (AMZN.O) top lawyer on Tuesday previewed the broad outlines of the company's possible defense against the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's antitrust lawsuit against the retailer, at a private companywide meeting.
articles.title: Exclusive: Amazon previews FTC defense at companywide meeting

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday to their lowest in over three months, after industry data showed a steep build in U.S. crude supplies, while mixed Chinese economic data raised worries about global demand for crude.
articles.title: Oil prices fall to over 3-month low on signs of higher supply

articles.author: Howard Schneider, Lindsay Dunsmuir
articles.description: Third-quarter U.S. economic growth, at an annualized 4.9% rate, was a "blowout" performance that warrants watching as the Federal Reserve considers its next policy moves, Fed Governor Christopher Waller said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Fed's Waller calls Q3 US GDP growth a 'blowout' number that warrants watching

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel
articles.description: Israel's ground forces in the Gaza Strip aimed on Wednesday to locate and disable Hamas militants' vast tunnel network beneath the enclave, the next phase in an Israeli offensive that has killed thousands of Palestinians.
articles.title: Israel targets Hamas tunnels after encircling Gaza City

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Polls began closing on Tuesday in eastern Kentucky, where the state's gubernatorial contest was among several U.S. elections offering critical clues about where the electorate stands ahead of the 2024 presidential election.
articles.title: First US polls close as contests in Ohio, Virginia offer preview of 2024

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is due to arrive in Seoul on Wednesday for talks with his South Korean counterpart, as the allies step up cooperation in the face of growing concerns over North Korea's closer military ties with Russia.
articles.title: Blinken visits South Korea as North Korea, Russia deepen ties
